title: ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE error when running with --minimal-config
body:
Hi,

I'm getting the following error on the validator nodes when running with `--minimal-config`:

level=info msg="New assignment" attesterSlot=670 committeeIndex=1 epoch=83 prefix=validator proposerSlot=665 pubKey=0x967adfdd3ffa status=ACTIVE validatorIndex=39
level=error msg="Failed to request block from beacon node" error="rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not get ETH1 data: could not fetch ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE ancestor: could not query block with given height: invalid argument 0: hex string without 0x prefix" prefix=validator pubKey=0x967adfdd3ffa


Beacon chain commit: 67c380b197536a3cf2309c200897ba5d2d8b1ddd
Validators' commit: 67c380b197536a3cf2309c200897ba5d2d8b1ddd

I've compiled with modified demo config as it was before `0.3.1` release :
```
--- a/shared/params/config.go
+++ b/shared/params/config.go
@@ -228,14 +228,8 @@ func MainnetConfig() *BeaconChainConfig {
 // DemoBeaconConfig retrieves the demo beacon chain config. This is mainnet config with 1/10th of
 // mainnet deposit values.
 func DemoBeaconConfig() *BeaconChainConfig {
-       demoConfig := *MainnetConfig()
-
-       demoConfig.MinDepositAmount /= 10
-       demoConfig.MaxEffectiveBalance /= 10
-       demoConfig.EjectionBalance /= 10
-       demoConfig.EffectiveBalanceIncrement /= 10
-
-       demoConfig.InactivityPenaltyQuotient /= 10
+       demoConfig := *MinimalSpecConfig()
+       demoConfig.Eth1FollowDistance = 16
 
        // Increment this number after a full testnet tear down.
        demoConfig.GenesisForkVersion = []byte{0, 0, 0, 4}
```

In that case, I'm getting the following error on the beacon node:


time="2020-01-09 19:47:36" level=error msg="Could not receive attestation in chain service" error="could not process attestation from fork choice service: target root does not exist in db" prefix=blockchain targetRoot=0x74328e583b9235d84384df921ec71cdc352be9f40070f82a3806ca2ba2befae1
time="2020-01-09 19:47:36" level=debug msg="Updated latest votes" AggregatedBitfield="[00010101]" BeaconBlockRoot=0x5346fc672e19 Index=0 Slot=224 prefix=forkchoice
time="2020-01-09 19:47:42" level=error msg="Could not receive attestation in chain service" error="could not process attestation from fork choice service: target root does not exist in db" prefix=blockchain targetRoot=0x74328e583b9235d84384df921ec71cdc352be9f40070f82a3806ca2ba2befae1
time="2020-01-09 19:47:42" level=error msg="Could not receive attestation in chain service" error="could not process attestation from fork choice service: target root does not exist in db" prefix=blockchain targetRoot=0x74328e583b9235d84384df921ec71cdc352be9f40070f82a3806ca2ba2befae1
time="2020-01-09 19:47:46" level=debug msg="Latest eth1 chain event" blockHash=0x4296bc2ee18b86dc1fdfd7f5e146314b308aa7bb2fe8ea251da560d39b6baa79 blockNumber=398 prefix=powchain

and the following on the validator nodes:

time="2020-01-09 19:52:00" level=info msg="Submitted new attestations" AggregatorIndices=[16] AttesterIndices=[16] BeaconBlockRoot=0x5346fc672e19 CommitteeIndex=0 Slot=269 SourceEpoch=0 SourceRoot=0x000000000000 TargetEpoch=33 TargetRoot=0x74328e583b92 prefix=validator
time="2020-01-09 19:52:06" level=error msg="Failed to request block from beacon node" error="rpc error: code = Internal desc = Could not compute state root: could not calculate state root at slot 0: could not process block: could not process block header: parent root 0x5346fc672e19bb2425e4e591d96fba7583b2523d0f1ee1295490011d876229e4 does not match the latest block header signing root in state 0x74328e583b9235d84384df921ec71cdc352be9f40070f82a3806ca2ba2befae1" prefix=validator pubKey=0x89cc92ec0fa8

I was getting `Could not get ETH1 data: could not fetch ETH1_FOLLOW_DISTANCE ancestor: could not query block with given height: invalid argument 0: hex string without 0x prefix` due to having less than 1024 blocks in ETH1 chain. Fixed by waiting for some time till ETH1 chain will have more than `1024` blocks as defined in `Eth1FollowDistance` of `defaultBeaconConfig` config.

The `Could not receive attestation in chain service" error="could not process attestation from fork choice service: target root does not exist in db` was due to not compiling with `--define ssz=minimal` bazel flag.
